form.longName: PhenX Tobacco Brand And Variety Smokeless Tobacco - PX730703
form.preferredDefinition: Questions to discern the smokeless tobacco brands or varieties used and purchased by respondents within a 12-month period.

question.questionText: 1. Have you ever used any of the following smokeless tobacco products, even one or two times? Choose all that apply.

validValue.meaningText: Loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, or chewing tobacco
I have never used a smokeless tobacco product

question.questionText: 2. Do you now use snus pouches, loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, or chewing tobacco?
3. [Do/ Did] you have a regular brand of smokeless tobacco, such as loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, and chewing tobacco that you usually [use/ used]?
ASK: Current users and 12 month former users . PROGRAM: For current users ask "Do" and "use" for 12month former users ask "Did" and "used"
4. What brand of smokeless tobacco, such as loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, and chewing tobacco [do I/ did] you [usually/ last] use? Please select it from the choices below.
5. You selected [Response to Q4] as your brand. What kind of [smokeless tobacco brand] [do I/ did] you [usually I last] use? Please select it from the choices below.
6. You said that your brand was not indicated above. What is it?
7. You said that the type of [BRANDFILL]s that you [use/used] is not listed. What type is it?
8. [Is/was] [your regular brand/ the last brand] you [use/ used] flavored to taste like menthol, mint, clove, spice, candy, fruit, chocolate, alcohol (such as wine or cognac), or other sweets?

9. About how long (did you use/have you been using) your regular brand of smokeless tobacco, such as loose, snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, and chewing tobacco? Please enter the number and indicate whether it is years, months, or days.
10. You said earlier that you used smokeless tobacco [TIME OF LAST USE]. Think about the very last time you used it. Was the brand [NEQBRAND]?
11. You said earlier that you last used snus [TIME OF LAST USE]. Think about the very last pouch you used. Was the brand Camel snus, General snus, Marlboro snus, or Nordic Ice?

protocol.longName: Tobacco Brand and Variety - Smokeless Tobacco
protocol.preferredDefinition: Questions to discern the smokeless tobacco brands or varieties used and purchased by respondents within a 12-month period.

form.longName: PhenX Tobacco Product Adulteration Vent Or Filter Blocking - PX730801
form.preferredDefinition: The Kozlowski et al. interviewer-administered protocol consists of eight fixed-response questions and one open-ended question asking respondents whether they currently or have ever used filter or vent blocked cigarettes and their perceptions of the effects of doing so.

question.questionText: Have you ever seen or heard that one or more rings of small holes are on the filters of some cigarettes?
How do you know about these holes?

validValue.meaningText: Read about them in the news or magazine
Saw a television advertisement about them
Saw or heard a news report about them

question.questionText: Did you ever try to block the filter holes on cigarettes?
How did you block the filter holes?
At the present time do you block holes when you smoke?
Do you think that blocking filter holes would make a cigarette taste stronger, milder, or have no effect?
Do you think that blocking filter holes would increase, decrease, or have no effect on the tar a smoker gets from these cigarettes?
Do you think that blocking filter holes would increase, decrease, or have no effect on the nicotine a smoker gets form these cigarettes?

Analyses: Responses to the last three questions were recoded in the following manner: those who responded "no effect," "a little milder," "moderately milder," "a lot milder," or "don't know" to the question regarding the effect of blocking on cigarette taste, for example, were classified as being "unaware." Similarly, those participants who responded "no effect," "slightly decrease," "moderately decrease," "greatly decrease," or "don't know" to the questions regarding the effect of blocking on tar and nicotine yields were also classified as being "unaware." Response percentages were calculated within each brand category, with 95% confidence intervals (CIs). Betweengroup tests were done using analyses of variance with Bonferroni adjustments for comparisons or with X2 analyses.30 Withingroup comparisons were done with paired t tests. Multiple regression analyses (ordinary least squares, linear probability model) were used to explore predictors of knowledge of vents (scored 1 = yes, 2 = no, don't know) and knowledge that blocking increased tar intake (scored 1 = increase tar, 2 = no effect, decrease tar, don't know). Brand category was included in the regression analyses to adjust for group membership effects. All probability values are for twosided tests.

protocol.longName: Tobacco Product Adulteration - Vent or Filter Blocking
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Kozlowski et al. interviewer-administered protocol consists of eight fixed-response questions and one open-ended question asking respondents whether they currently or have ever used filter or vent blocked cigarettes and their perceptions of the effects of doing so.

form.longName: PhenX Tobacco Warning Label Exposure And Recall - PX730901
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses a combination of questions from the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study and the 2015 International Tobacco Control (ITC) 4-Country Survey instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to assess the effectiveness of health warnings on tobacco packages, which have been associated with perceptions of risk and may promote smoking cessation and reduce uptake among young people.

question.questionText: In the past 30 days, how often, if at all, have you read or looked closely at the health warnings on cigarette packages?
I want you to think about the health warnings that currently appear on the exterior of CIGARETTE PACKS. I'd like you to describe the first warning that comes to mind, if any.
Please describe the next health warning that comes to mind.
Do any others come to mind?
Precoded checklist:
SURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING: Cigarette Smoke Contains Carbon Monoxide.
SURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING: Quitting Smoking Now Greatly Reduces Serious Risks to Your Health.
SURGEON GENERAL'S WARNING: Smoking Causes Lung Cancer, Heart Disease, Emphysema, and May Complicate Pregnancy.

protocol.longName: Tobacco Warning Label Exposure and Recall
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses a combination of questions from the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study and the 2015 International Tobacco Control (ITC) 4-Country Survey instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to assess the effectiveness of health warnings on tobacco packages, which have been associated with perceptions of risk and may promote smoking cessation and reduce uptake among young people.

form.longName: PhenX Exposure To Tobacco Marketing Through Internet And Socia - PX740101
form.preferredDefinition: Items that assess exposure to tobacco marketing on the Internet and in social media were chosen from the 2012 National Youth Tobacco Survey (NYTS) and the 2013 Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Wave 1 Youth Module. Specifically, questions related to the opportunities for exposure and frequency of exposure to tobacco marketing on the Internet and in social media and to tobacco-related content.

question.questionText: 1. When you are using the Internet, how often do you see any ads or promotions for cigarettes or other tobacco products?

validValue.meaningText: I do not use the Internet (Go to Q7)

question.questionText: 2. Overall, how often do you use the Internet?
3. Do you have a Facebook, Google Plus, MySpace, Twitter, or other social networking account?
4. How often do you visit your Facebook, Google Plus, MySpace, Twitter, or other social networking account?
5. Has anyone discussed tobacco products on your Facebook, Google Plus, MySpace, Twitter, or other social networking account?
6. In the past 6 months, have you ever signed up for email alerts about tobacco products, read articles online about tobacco products, or watched a video online about tobacco products?
7. During the past 30 days, did a tobacco company send you information (other than coupons) through ... (CHOOSE ALL THAT APPLY)

validValue.meaningText: I did not receive any information from a tobacco company

question.questionText: 8. In the past 6 months, did a tobacco company send you any information other than coupons?
9. How did a tobacco company send you any information other than coupons? Choose all that apply.

validValue.meaningText: Social Networks (such as Facebook and Twitter)

question.questionText: How did a tobacco company send you any information other than coupons?

protocol.longName: Exposure to Tobacco Marketing through Internet and Social Media Use
protocol.preferredDefinition: Items that assess exposure to tobacco marketing on the Internet and in social media were chosen from the 2012 National Youth Tobacco Survey (NYTS) and the 2013 Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Wave 1 Youth Module. Specifically, questions related to the opportunities for exposure and frequency of exposure to tobacco marketing on the Internet and in social media and to tobacco-related content.

form.longName: PhenX Illicit Tobacco Products - PX740201
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Pricing Policies and Control of Tobacco in Europe (PPACTE) survey instrument. These specific questions are used to identify illicit tobacco products and to measure the extent of illicit tobacco products in the market. A pack is identified as illicit if it had at least one of the following tax avoidance or evasion indicators: (1) it was bought from sources that do not include all applicable taxes in the user's location (e.g., a lower tax jurisdiction, such as a neighboring state or a Native American reservation), as reported by smokers; (2) it had an inappropriate tax stamp (e.g., one from a location other than the user's location); (3) it had an inappropriate (e.g., one different from the labels employed in the user's location) health warning; or (4) its price was substantially below the known price in their market (e.g., 20% or more below the average local price).

question.questionText: 1. Do you currently smoke cigarettes (including handrolled cigarettes)?
2a. Think about the total number of cigarettes you used/had during the last 30 days. As a percentage, how many of them did you buy from legitimate retailers/tobacco shops?
2b. Think about the total number of cigarettes you used/had during the last 30 days. As a percentage, how many of them did you buy from vending machines?
2c. Think about the total number of cigarettes you used/had during the last 30 days. As a percentage, how many of them did you buy over the internet?
2d. Think about the total number of cigarettes you used/had during the last 30 days. As a percentage, how many of them did you buy from shops in other countries?
2e. Think about the total number of cigarettes you used/had during the last 30 days. As a percentage, how many of them did you buy from duty free shops?

2f. Think about the total number of cigarettes you used/had during the last 30 days. As a percentage, how many of them did you buy from an individual selling cigarettes independently at local markets, delivery service, doortodoor, or just in the street, or cheap cigarettes from legitimate retailers [UK, Spain] ?
2g. Think about the total number of cigarettes you used/had during the last 30 days. As a percentage, how many of them did you buy from peers ?
3. Please, could you show me the latest pack of cigarettes or handrolling tobacco that you bought?
INTERVIEWER: COLLECT ALL THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION FROM THE PACK. IF IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO SEE THE LATEST PACK BOUGHT, THEN ASK THE INTERVIEWEE TO PROVIDE THE INFORMATION REQUIRED
3a. If you do not have it with you, could you remember the following information on your last pack of cigarettes or handrolling tobacco? Type of pack:
3a continued: Type of pack: Hand rolling tobacco, please enter Grams: Other type, please enter:
3b. Health warnings
3c. Tax stamp (banderole)
3c Continued: Tax stamp (banderole) Country
3d. How much did you pay for it?
3e. Where did you buy it?

validValue.meaningText: National legal tobacco shopts/legitimate retialers (full price) (UK, Spain)
Individual selling cigarettes independently at local markets, delivery service, door-to-door, or just in the street, or cheap cigarettes from legitimate retailers (UK, Spain)

protocol.longName: Illicit Tobacco Products
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Pricing Policies and Control of Tobacco in Europe (PPACTE) survey instrument. These specific questions are used to identify illicit tobacco products and to measure the extent of illicit tobacco products in the market. A pack is identified as illicit if it had at least one of the following tax avoidance or evasion indicators: (1) it was bought from sources that do not include all applicable taxes in the user's location (e.g., a lower tax jurisdiction, such as a neighboring state or a Native American reservation), as reported by smokers; (2) it had an inappropriate tax stamp (e.g., one from a location other than the user's location); (3) it had an inappropriate (e.g., one different from the labels employed in the user's location) health warning; or (4) its price was substantially below the known price in their market (e.g., 20% or more below the average local price).

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Exposure To And Use Of Price Promotions Fo - PX740401
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes 14 questions taken from a combination of the Wave 1 Adult and Youth Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to measure consumer exposure to tobacco-product price promotions, including (but not limited to) lower price paid or free tobacco products, discounted prices when buying multiple tobacco product units, and free or discounted tobacco product with purchase of tobacco products.

question.questionText: In the past 6 months, have you gotten a discount coupon for any tobacco product? ASK: All respondents
Where did you get discount coupons from? Choose all that apply.

validValue.meaningText: Social Networks (such as Facebook and Twitter)
On a cigarette pack or other tobacco product
From a friend or other person

question.questionText: SPECIFY Where did you get discount coupons from?
In the past 6 months, have you received an email message with promotions or coupons for cigarettes or tobacco products? ASK: All respondents
In the past 6 months, have you received promotions or coupons for cigarettes or tobacco products in the mail? ASK: All respondents
In the past 6 months, have you used a discount coupon to purchase a tobacco product?

In the past 30 days, when you were in a store that sells tobacco, did you buy a brand of tobacco product other than your usual brand because you noticed a special price offer? ASK: Current tobacco users who have a regular brand
In the past 30 days, have you bought a brand of tobacco product other than your usual brand because of a promotion? ASK: Current tobacco users who have a regular brand
In the past 30 days, has this happened just once or twice, a few times, or quite regularly?
In the past 30 days, have you ever bought a brand of tobacco product because you noticed a promotion for it? ASK: All respondents
In the past 6 months, have you seen a tobacco sweepstakes ad? ASK: All respondents
In the past 6 months, have you participated in a tobacco sponsored sweepstakes? ASK: All respondents
In the past 30 days, have you bought a brand of tobacco product other than your usual brand because of a promotion? ASK: Current tobacco users who have a regular brand
Have you ever used a smart phone to scan a QR code for a tobacco product or to enter a sweepstakes or drawing from a tobacco company?
In the past 30 days, did you use a coupon when buying cigarettes? ASK: Current users

validValue.meaningText: I did not buy cigarettes in the past 30 days (END QUESTIONNAIRE)

question.questionText: How many times in the past 30 days have you used a coupon to buy cigarettes?

protocol.longName: Self-reported Exposure to and Use of Price Promotions for Tobacco Products
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes 14 questions taken from a combination of the Wave 1 Adult and Youth Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to measure consumer exposure to tobacco-product price promotions, including (but not limited to) lower price paid or free tobacco products, discounted prices when buying multiple tobacco product units, and free or discounted tobacco product with purchase of tobacco products.

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Exposure To Tobacco Advertising At Point O - PX740501
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses a combination of questions from the Wave 1 Adult and Wave 2 Youth Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to measure consumer exposure to tobacco-product advertisements, which have been proven to increase the appeal of and demand for tobacco products.

question.questionText: In the past 30 days, how often did you visit a convenience store, small market, or liquor store? ASK: All respondents.
In the past 30 days, when you visited convenience stores, small markets, or liquor stores, how often did you see ads for ecigarettes?
In the past 30 days, when you visited convenience stores, small markets, or liquor stores, how often did you see ads for tobacco products?

The next questions are about things you may have seen inside or outside shops or stores where people can buy tobacco products. In the past 30 days, have you seen cigarette or other tobacco packages being displayed, including on shelves or on the counter? ASK: All respondents

Since you quit using tobacco, has there been a time when seeing a tobacco product display or other signs that tobacco is sold there, has given you an urge to buy tobacco? ASK: Former tobacco users who are not experimental current users of tobacco

protocol.longName: Self-reported Exposure to Tobacco Advertising at Point of Sale
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses a combination of questions from the Wave 1 Adult and Wave 2 Youth Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to measure consumer exposure to tobacco-product advertisements, which have been proven to increase the appeal of and demand for tobacco products.

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Exposure To Tobacco Product Advertisements - PX740601
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses a combination of questions from the 2011 International Tobacco Control (ITC) 4-Country Survey and the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to assess tobacco product advertising and marketing exposure, in adult and youth populations, through traditional channels, such as magazines, television, and radio.

question.questionText: Now I want to ask you about tobacco advertising. In the last 6 months, have you noticed cigarettes or tobacco products being advertised on posters or billboards?
Now I want to ask you about tobacco advertising. In the last 6 months, have you noticed cigarettes or tobacco products being advertised in newspapers or magazines?
Now I want to ask you about tobacco advertising. In the last 6 months, have you noticed cigarettes or tobacco products being advertised on radio?
The following questions ask about tobacco advertising that you may have seen.
What is the brand of your favorite tobacco advertisement?

validValue.meaningText: I do not have a favorite advertisement

question.questionText: DISPLAY 20 RANDOMLY SELECTED TOBACCO ADS HERE, ONE AT A TIME AND ASK THE QUESTIONS FOR EVERY AD
In the past 12 months, have you seen this advertisement before this study?

validValue.meaningText: No (GO TO NEXT AD; IF LAST AD, END)
Don't know (GO TO NEXT AD; IF LAST AD, END)
Refused (GO TO NEXT AD; IF LAST AD, END)

protocol.longName: Self-reported Exposure to Tobacco Product Advertisements
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol uses a combination of questions from the 2011 International Tobacco Control (ITC) 4-Country Survey and the Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Study instruments. Collectively, the questions are used to assess tobacco product advertising and marketing exposure, in adult and youth populations, through traditional channels, such as magazines, television, and radio.

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Exposure To Tobacco Product Sponsorships - PX740701
form.preferredDefinition: These questions from the International Tobacco Control (ITC) 4-Country Survey are directly related to exposure to tobacco product sponsorships.

question.questionText: Thinking again about the last 6 months have you seen or heard about any sport or sporting event that is sponsored by or connected with BRANDS of cigarettes?
Thinking again about the last 6 months have you seen or heard about any Sport or sporting event that is sponsored by or connected with tobacco COMPANIES?
Thinking again about the last 6 months have you seen or heard about any Music, theater, art, or fashion events that are sponsored by or connected with BRANDS of cigarettes?

protocol.longName: Self-reported Exposure to Tobacco Product Sponsorships
protocol.preferredDefinition: These questions from the International Tobacco Control (ITC) 4-Country Survey are directly related to exposure to tobacco product sponsorships.

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Tobacco Product Price Paid Cigarettes - PX740801
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the price paid for cigarettes.

question.questionText: ASK Current users and 12month former users . For current smokers, display "buy" and "do" For 12month former smokers, display "bought and "did."

When you [buy/bought] cigarettes for yourself, [do/did] you usually buy manufactured cigarettes or a pouch of tobacco to rollyourown cigarettes? Choose all that apply.ASK: Current users and former users 12 month
Do you usually buy cigarettes by the carton, pack or as single cigarettes?
How many packs of cigarettes are in the carton you usually buy?
How many packs of cigarettes are in the carton you usually buy?
How much do you usually pay for a carton of cigarettes?
How much do you usually pay for a carton of cigarettes?
How much do you usually pay for a pack of cigarettes?
How much do you usually pay for a pack of cigarettes?
How much do you usually pay for a single cigarette?
How much do you usually pay for a single cigarette?

protocol.longName: Self-reported Tobacco Product Price Paid - Cigarettes
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the price paid for cigarettes.

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Tobacco Product Price Paid Cigars - PX740802
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the price paid for cigars.

question.questionText: ASK Current users and bluntonly cigar smokers. If BLUNT_ONLY_GRILLO = 1, display "cigarillos for blunts" and "cigarillos" in question and option 2. If BLUNT_ONLY_GFC = 1, display "filtered cigars for blunts" and "filtered cigars" in question and option 2. Else display [CIGARFILL]s.
1.Do you usually buy [[CIGARFILL]s/cigarillos for blunts/filtered cigars for blunts] by the box or as single [[CIGARFILL]s/cigarillos/filtered cigars]?
2. How many [[CIGARFILL]s/cigarillos/filtered cigars] come in the box that you usually buy [for blunts]?
2a.How many [[CIGARFILL]s/cigarillos/filtered cigars] come in the box that you usually buy [for blunts]?
3.How much do you usually pay for a box of [[CIGARFILL]s/cigarillos for blunts/filtered cigars for blunts]?
3a.How much do you usually pay for a box of [[CIGARFILL]s/cigarillos for blunts/filtered cigars for blunts]?
4.How much do you usually pay for a single [[CIGARFILL]/cigarillo for a blunt/filtered cigar for a blunt]?
4a. How much do you usually pay for a single [[CIGARFILL]/cigarillo for a blunt/filtered cigar for a blunt]?

protocol.longName: Self-reported Tobacco Product Price Paid - Cigars
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the price paid for cigars.

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Tobacco Product Price Paid Ecigarettes - PX740803
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the price paid for e-cigarettes.

question.questionText: Do you own an ecigarette?
About how much did you pay for your ecigarette? Do not include the cost of additional cartridges or accessories unless they were included in a starter kit.

protocol.longName: Self-reported Tobacco Product Price Paid - E-Cigarettes
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the price paid for e-cigarettes.

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Tobacco Product Price Paid Smokeless Tob - PX740804
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the price paid for smokeless tobacco such as snus pouches, loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, and chewing tobacco. Common brands include Redman<sup></sup>, Levi Garrett<sup></sup>, Beechnut<sup></sup>, Skoal<sup></sup>, Grizzly, Nordic Ice<sup></sup>, and Copenhagen<sup></sup>.

question.questionText: How much do you usually pay for a container of [SMKLSSFILL] = smokeless tobacco snus?
How much do you usually pay for a container of [SMKLSSFILL] = smokeless tobacco snus?
How many pouches are in the container of snus that you usually buy?
How many pouches are in the container of snus that you usually buy?

protocol.longName: Self-reported Tobacco Product Price Paid - Smokeless Tobacco
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the price paid for smokeless tobacco such as snus pouches, loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, and chewing tobacco. Common brands include Redman<sup></sup>, Levi Garrett<sup></sup>, Beechnut<sup></sup>, Skoal<sup></sup>, Grizzly, Nordic Ice<sup></sup>, and Copenhagen<sup></sup>.

form.longName: PhenX Selfreported Tobacco Product Purchase Location Cigare - PX740901
form.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the purchase location of cigarettes.

question.questionText: ASK Current users and 12month former users.Display instruction for question and response option 4 fills: for current smokers, display "do." For 12month former smokers, display "did." For current smokers or 12month former smokers who smoke manufactured cigarettes, display "cigarettes."For current smokers or 12month former smokers who smoke rollyourown cigarettes, display "a pouch of rollyourown cigarette tobacco" (and "cigarette tobacco" in response option 4).
How [do/did] you usually buy [cigarettes/a pouch of rollyourown cigarette tobacco] for yourself? Is it...

validValue.meaningText: I [do/did] not buy my own [cigarettes/cigarette tobacco]

question.questionText: [Do/Did] you usually buy [cigarettes/rollyourown cigarette tobacco]...?
Where [do/did] you buy your [cigarettes/rollyourown cigarette tobacco] most of the time?

validValue.meaningText: A convenience store or gas station
A supermarket, grocery store, or drug store
A warehouse club, such as Sam's or Costco
A smoke shop, tobacco specialty store, or tobacco outlet store
A duty-free shop or military commisionary
A bar, pub, restaurant, or casino
A swap meet or flea market
A store on an Indian reservation

question.questionText: Where [do/did] you buy your [cigarettes/rollyourown cigarette tobacco] most of the time?

protocol.longName: Self-reported Tobacco Product Purchase Location - Cigarettes
protocol.preferredDefinition: This protocol includes questions from the Wave 1 Adult Population Assessment of Tobacco and Health (PATH) Survey instrument. These specific questions are used to measure the purchase location of cigarettes.
